title: Can I send an SAT with an essay to colleges that don’t require the essay? What will happen if I do? - Quora
tags: Advice About the SAT (standardized college admission test)

response.answer_text: Nothing. There is one college, Hampshire College in Massachusetts that tells students that if they send the SAT scores they will be ignored. It is just as if you sent a watermelon to the admissions office. It might elicit a few smiles, but it won’t be counted toward your admission portfolio. But a word of advice. Do your homework. Look at the admissions criteria for schools in which you are interested, and follow them to a T. This shows that you can actually read—a very good college skill. Here is the lowdown on schools that don’t require the SAT or ACT., or some of the tests. Complete Guide: Colleges Not Requiring SAT Scores

Nothing will happen if you send scores or essays to colleges that don’t use them in admissions. Each year more colleges are going “test optional”, meaning that you don’t use scores in admissions decisions. Very few require essays so unless one of the colleges on you list requires or recommends an essay, don’t bother to take that addition to the SAT or ACT.

Can I send an SAT with an essay to colleges that don’t require the essay? What will happen if I do? YES. They know how to process them and will have an approach to filter and select only what is of their interest. No issues, please go ahead and submit.

Yes it’s fine. That just means they don’t require the essay. Some may not even look at the writing score, others may still factor it in if you are applying anywhere that requires the essay you will send that score to all schools.

Most receive the information through electronic means. They get to set up what they wish to see. Essentially, most schools only want to see the bottom line numbers and that’s all they set up to look at. If they have indicated they don’t want the essay, the Board will not even send that part.
